item.title: The Basics of Simulation
item.description: Background This post explores some of the basic concepts of simulation. I mostly explore these concepts using basic probablity and the built in distribution functions. This is a reproducible example if you have R Studio just make sure you have installed the correct packages. Ideas from Probablity Course https://www.probabilitycourse.com/chapter13/chapter13.php set.seed(123) p <- 0.5 n <- 1000 U <- runif(n) toss <- as.integer(U < p) #cumalative number of heads a <- numeric(n+1) #running average of heads avg <- numeric(n) for(i in 2:n+1){ a[i] <- a[i-1] + toss[i-1] avg[i-1] <- a[i]/(i-1) } plot(1:n, avg, type = "l", lwd = 5, col = "blue", ylab = "ProportionofHeads", xlab = "CoinTossNumber") rm(p,n,U,toss,a,avg, i) set.
